name: Glance
description: "Glance is a collection of photographs both very new and very old by Jessica Williams--most of them never before seen. Although the images were taken very far apart from each other in time, they seem to form a seamless dream-like narrative. Glance is about looking into both the past and the future at the same time, and ending up somewhere in between. Printed on large, unbound tabloid sheets--the zine can be taken apart to form a series of posters with the images carefully reconfigured by the artist." (written by Jesscia Wiiliams) Artist's Zine by Jessica Williams (USA) Edition of 200, 16 pp, Offset Printing (Color) Published Sep.24, 2009 Design Assistant Oh Kyungseok www.paperheart.org

name: D.I.Y. Satellite
description: The first artist book of Song hojun, who's leading Open Source Satellite Initiative and making D.I.Y. satellite, is published. Based on artist's sketch and manual of D.I.Y. Satellite, this zine contains thoughts on private space program, its execution plan, and things are going to happen afterward. Artist's Zine by Song hojun (Korea) Edition of 200, 18 x 24 cm, 40 pp, Offset Printing (B&W) Published Oct. 23, 2009 Designed by Jin Jung www.hhjjj.com

name: Awful Colony
description:
Nick Hoffman was born a Sagittarius in Peoria, Illinois. He founded the Scissor Death record label in 2006. He has released tapes, cds, and zines under his own name and with other groups such as Back Magic, VEYOU, and Katchmare. He currently lives near Chicago.

Artist's Zine by Nick Hoffman (USA)
Edition of 200
18 x 24 cm, Master Print 
Published 2009

name: Parts of Small Time Adventures
description: Nigel Peake works from an attic on a quiet road a few miles from the coast. Past the clutter of out turned pockets and spirals of paper on his desk is a small window with a view onto a row of trees full in bloom. Peake achieved a RIBA silver award commendation while an architecture student at the University of Edinburgh. His art has recently been exhibited in Antwerp, Los Angeles, New York, Portland and Shanghai and his drawings used in a variety of projects. The work collected here is photos and drawings from excursions to some of the corners of the world. Further work can be seen at www.secondstreet.co.uk Artist's Zine by Nigel Peake Edition of 200 18 x 24 cm, Offset Published June, 2009

name: Walk on Red
description:
Soundscapes on Broadway collects the aural landscape of Broadway running through Manhattan. 26789 steps, 233 minutes, 15 miles from Battery Park to Broadway Bridge.

Artist's Book by Hoon Kim (Korea)
